title:
Quark spin effects in $e^+e^-$ annihilation: a Monte Carlo event
  generator study
authors: A. Kerbizi, L. L\"onnblad and A. Martin
abstract:
Quark spin effects in $e^+e^-$ annihilation to pseudoscalar and vector mesons
are implemented for the first time in the PYTHIA Monte Carlo event generator.
The spin-dependent fragmentation of the string stretched between the produced
quark-antiquark pair with correlated spin states is described by the
string+${}^3P_0$ model implemented in the string fragmentation routine of
PYTHIA by using the StringSpinner package. The simulated events are used to
study the model predictions for the Collins asymmetries of mesons produced
back-to-back in the $e^+e^-$ center of mass system by using both the thrust
axis method and the hadronic plane method. The obtained asymmetries are
compared to the available data from the BELLE and BABAR experiments and the
underlying Collins analysing power from the string+${}^3P_0$ model is compared
with phenomenological extractions.
